law.catch_line: There is a Class F beer, wine and liquor license....

text.section: There is a Class F beer, wine and liquor license.
The annual license fee is $200, which shall be paid to the Office of the Comptroller before the license is issued.

The license shall be issued by the Office of the Comptroller and authorizes the owner or operator of any steam, diesel, or electric railway or club, parlor, buffet, observation, sleeping or dining cars upon the lines of any steam, diesel, or electric railway in this State, to keep for sale and to sell all alcoholic beverages upon any of such cars for consumption upon such cars, and every such license shall be good throughout the State.
